page.title: 19Scalford School
page.content: Scalford School opened in 1844, in a building given by Thomas Webster, which used to be a chapel. In 1866 and 1874 the school was improved but the most recent change was in 1983 when indoor toilets and a cloakroom were built. Because this made the back yard so small we have we have worked together with some of our parents to make it in to an Activity Area,with places for animals and plants to grow.Now we can work or play outside when it is fine. Though our school once had about 100 pupils now there are only 41 children from the villages and farms around. We only have 2 teachers,but we do lots of activities like art and craft, swimming, science, P.E. and singing. We join with children from other schools for long visits or special activity days.
